meanings.definition: An official in certain ecclesiastical courts.
meanings.sent1: The protonotary oversaw the court proceedings with authority.
meanings.sent2: The protonotary kept detailed records of the church's legal matters.
meanings.sent3: The protonotary joked that he had the holiest job in town.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of church law, the protonotary was the gatekeeper of justice.
meanings.sent5: The protonotary's presence in the court was as solemn as the church bells.

meanings.definition: A chief clerk or notary in certain courts.
meanings.sent1: As the protonotary, he managed all the court documents efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The protonotary's signature was required on all legal papers.
meanings.sent3: The protonotary playfully called himself the 'chief of paperwork'.
meanings.sent4: In the legal realm, the protonotary was the keeper of official records.
meanings.sent5: The protonotary's desk was always piled high with important files.
